info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 23 at 4:49PM AKST until November 24 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau AK
info.description:
...ACCUMULATING SNOW FOR HAINES MONDAY...
.A weak, decaying low pressure will bring moisture up from the south, generating snow showers for Haines, Lutak, and Mud Bay beginning early Monday morning. Highest uncertainty regarding this system is the depth of the moisture profile, which will dictate heavier rates. Slightly toned down the advisory amounts, but there is still potential for rates exceeding 0.5 inches, around 40%.
* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches.
* WHERE...Haines, Lutak, and Mud Bay.
* WHEN...From 3 AM to 6 PM AKST Monday.
* IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest snow rates are expected Monday morning, with rates possibly exceeding 0.5 inches per hour.
info.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.
People are urged to prepare their property before the onset of winter weather.
For the latest road conditions, where available, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.

parameter.value: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 6 PM AKST MONDAY
